definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
words/speech/to say/to talk
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
surname Cong

sentences.english: The secretaries were all things to their bosses.
sentences.chinese: 祕書們對老闆是言聽計從。

sentences.english: My brother is an amateur photographer and a very amenable individual.
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥是名業餘的攝影師，又是個言聽計從的人。

sentences.english: Proponents of economic nationalism had the president's ear.
sentences.chinese: 總統對於經濟民族主義的提議者則言聽計從。

sentences.english: Romeo: I take thee at thy word.
Men should do what their wives tell them to do. And they should not be too careful with their money.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫應該對妻子言聽計從，對錢則不要太吝嗇。

sentences.english: Eg: The henpecked husband carried out everything to his wife's letter.
sentences.chinese: 這個“妻管嚴”的丈夫對他的妻子言聽計從。

sentences.english: People do not question me , they listen and obey.
sentences.chinese: 人們從不會質疑我，他們言聽計從。

definition: to die in battle (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
traitor
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
talented field commander (military)
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
to settle a marriage/betrothal
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to harbor hard feelings
political enemy/opponent
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
complete nonsense (idiom)
